=== Game Rules ===
This is vgdl rule file:
BasicGame
  SpriteSet
    floor > Immovable randomtiling=0.9 img=oryx/floor3 hidden=True
    goal  > Door color=GREEN img=oryx/doorclosed1
    key   > Immovable color=ORANGE img=oryx/key2
    sword > OrientedFlicker limit=5 singleton=True img=oryx/slash1
    movable >
      avatar  > ShootAvatar   stype=sword frameRate=8
        nokey   > img=oryx/swordman1
        withkey > color=ORANGE img=oryx/swordmankey1
      enemy >  
        monsterQuick > RandomNPC cooldown=2 cons=6 img=oryx/bat1
        monsterNormal > RandomNPC cooldown=4 cons=8 img=oryx/spider2
        monsterSlow > RandomNPC cooldown=8 cons=12 img=oryx/scorpion1
      wall > Immovable autotiling=true img=oryx/wall3
      	

  LevelMapping
    g > floor goal
    + > floor key        
    A > floor nokey
    1 > floor monsterQuick
    2 > floor monsterNormal
    3 > floor monsterSlow
    w > wall
    . > floor
    

  InteractionSet
    movable wall  > stepBack
    nokey goal    > stepBack
    goal withkey  > killSprite scoreChange=1
    enemy sword > killSprite scoreChange=2
    enemy enemy > stepBack
    avatar enemy > killSprite scoreChange=-1
    nokey key     > transformTo stype=withkey scoreChange=1 killSecond=True

  TerminationSet
    SpriteCounter stype=goal   win=True
    SpriteCounter stype=avatar win=False
This is vgdl rule in natural language:
Here’s an overall look at the game’s design and what you should do:

• Game Genre and Feel:
 – It’s a maze‐style puzzle-action game. You navigate a level full of walls and hazards similar to a classic dungeon crawler.
 – There’s a mix of exploration, picking up key items, and timing your attacks against roaming enemies.

• Mechanics:
 – You control an avatar that can shoot a “sword” attack. The sword attack is fast-paced but has limited uses (it “flickers” and only shows up for a short time, with a limit of five).
 – The level is set up like a grid/maze, with walls placed to create corridors and rooms.
 – There are items like a key and a door. When your avatar (initially “nokey”) touches the key, it transforms into a “withkey” version (and you score points). This change is essential for progress.
 – Enemies come in different speeds (quick, normal, slow) and wander around the maze. They move randomly with varying delays (cooldowns) making them somewhat unpredictable.
 – Collisions lead to different outcomes: for example, if your keelless avatar touches the door, you’re pushed back; but if you approach with the key, interacting with the door “kills” (or removes) the goal sprite (and gives you points).
 – You also need to use your sword wisely against enemies: using the sword kills an enemy with a reward, while merely bumping into them with your avatar costs you points and may endanger you.

• Objective and Win/Loss Conditions:
 – The main goal is to escape: you need to collect the key first, then use it to “open” (i.e. remove) the door (goal sprite). When the door is gone, you win.
 – On the other hand, if your avatar gets destroyed (for example, colliding untimely with an enemy without using your sword), you lose.

• Overall Strategy:
 1. Explore and Plan Your Route:
  • Start by finding the key. Take note of the maze’s layout—look for the corridor that leads to where the key is located.
  • Because walls and the maze’s design limit your movement, plan a route that avoids enemy hotspots.

 2. Timing and Caution with Enemies:
  • Enemies roam randomly at different speeds. Avoid touching them without a plan.
  • When necessary, use your sword attack to clear a path, but remember it can only be used a few times. Save it for when an enemy is in your way or too close for comfort.

 3. Pick Up the Key:
  • Touching the key transforms your avatar (from “nokey” to “withkey”), a required step to interact safely with the door.
  • Since this transformation also gives you a slight score bonus, it’s important to secure it quickly if you see an enemy-free opportunity.

 4. Approach and Unlock the Door:
  • Once in “withkey” mode, make your way back to the door. You need to approach it with care: if you collide with the door before you have the key, it will just repel you.
  • When you’re ready and safe, interact with the door to “unlock” it. This interaction removes the door sprite and wins you the game.

 5. Keep Your Moves Calculated:
  • The maze layout, movable blocks, and enemy patterns require cautious moves. Use “step back” reactions wisely to reposition if you’re at risk.
  • Your score changes based on interactions—the game not only tests your puzzle-solving but also your ability to fight off enemies without unnecessary losses.

In essence, you need to plan, explore, and balance between avoiding enemies and using your limited sword attacks. Grab the key first, use your attacks sparingly to clear threats, and then head for the door to complete your escape. Enjoy the challenge as you manage both strategy and quick reflexes in the maze!

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.
